meanings.definition: In a manner showing acceptance of a situation without resistance or protest.
meanings.sent1: She nodded resignedly when told she had to stay late at work.
meanings.sent2: He sighed resignedly and started cleaning up the mess.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked resignedly at the closed door, realizing it couldn't go outside.
meanings.sent4: The old tree swayed resignedly in the wind, accepting its fate.
meanings.sent5: The student accepted the low grade resignedly, knowing they hadn't studied enough.

meanings.definition: With a feeling of submission or surrender.
meanings.sent1: The soldier raised his hands resignedly, knowing he was outnumbered.
meanings.sent2: She walked resignedly towards the principal's office after being caught skipping class.
meanings.sent3: The dog flopped down resignedly after being scolded for digging in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The sun set resignedly behind the mountains, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The defeated team left the field resignedly, accepting their loss.
